post.body: the wrestler at home? but it's wrestling! big screen!
its true. thank goodness for that, though. otherwise, nothing would ever get done.
i feel like it's generally parsley, bay, thyme, sage, rosemary. all of those or a few.
subway. even worse. hot box for flatulence overload.
Farts make me laugh. But farts come from people. So by associate property (?) people also make me laugh.
i love cramps! the muscle relaxants--for the back?
Oh lord. I say pick two of those, missy.
um, that's really incredibly sweet of you to say. thank you. i wasn't fishing when i posted that last tweet, though. hee hee.
awww, it's just such a niiiiice print. i am guilty of dali's persistence of memory as well as van gogh's starry night prints.
My Dads the same way. He'll shovel and snowblow people's driveways in the neighborhood. gets heroic during inclement weather.
i know this aint rocket science. but we dont feel bad necessarily because others feel bad. we feel bad cuz evolution. and shit.
didnt do anything mean. but never really thought of that. our reasons 4 not acting badly toward others 4 still selfish. guilt dont feel good
i am just sort of figuring out the reason why a person feels bad after they do something mean. so that they won't do it again.
it's a really fascinating topic to me. one i'd like to explore further in a respectful manner.
was on fetlife last night reading about aspergers syndrome folks (or aspies) and folks with other learning disabilities involved in BDSM.
i want to emotionally eat right now. i need to buy carrots and celery this week.
which is like the nicest compliment i've received in a long time.
a friend just said: I was thinking that you were possibly one of the most solid people I knew in terms of your grasp on the human heart
beef barley soup from zabars is very tart! delicious.
